insights: The 2026 Kawasaki ZXX has a new design team and a more aggressive look compared to the old ZX-6R.
The bike has a new color scheme with a lot more light green and white, which adds character to the bike.
The riding position is very sporty, but not as extreme as a ZX-10R, with a slightly higher and wider handlebar.
The bike has a single seat cowl, which means it doesn't have rear pillion pegs or a pillion seat, making it more suitable for solo riders.
The proportions of the bike are typical of a super sport bike, with a big chunky 17-inch fuel tank and a racy riding position.
The seat is quite spacious and comfortable, with a lot of clearance for the rider's thumbs and a nice interface between the knee and the fuel tank.
The bike is designed to be ridden on the road, with about 90% of customers using it for daily riding, rather than track riding.
